column2: WISCONSIN DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column6: WI

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column6: only on the left and right side

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 3. To enter a freeway:
column4: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column6: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column8: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column10: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.

column2: 4. Emergency vehicles:
column6: have the right-of-way when using siren and red/blue lights.
column8: may use a loudspeaker to give instructions.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column6: Slippery when wet

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column6: No parking

column2: 7. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column6: Guide signs (horizontal rectangle)

column2: 8. When you see this sign, you should:
column6: slow down, proceed with caution and watch for blind people.
column8: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.
column10: stop at the crosswalk until a crossing guard signals you to go.

column2: 9. These are:
column6: regulatory signs.

column2: 10. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column6: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column8: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column10: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.

column2: 11. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 12. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column6: if it’s raining.
column8: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 13. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column6: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column8: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column6: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way
column10: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 15. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column6: pass red lights.

column2: 16. Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
column6: make you feel better.
column8: help you to be a better driver.

column2: 17. Drivers turning left must yield to:
column6: None of the above.

column2: 18. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column6: frequent rest stops.
column10: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.

column2: 19. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column6: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.

column2: 20. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column6: signal.
column8: look at your interior rear-view mirror.

column2: 21. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column6: green, yellow and red

column2: 22. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column6: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column6: Exit

column2: 24. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column6: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column8: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.

column2: 25. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: are easier for the driver to operate.
column6: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.
column8: require more space for turning movements.
column10: take longer than cars to stop.

column2: 26. This road sign is:
column6: a warning sign.

column2: 27. If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, you should:
column6: apply the brakes firmly.
column10: slow down gradually and brake lightly.

column2: 28. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.
column6: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column8: look toward the left side of the road.
column10: look toward the right side of the road.

column2: 29. If a vehicle is coming towards you at night with its high beams on, making it hard to see the road ahead, you should:
column4: look ahead towards the left edge of your lane.
column6: look straight ahead towards the middle of the lane.
column8: look ahead towards the right edge of your lane.

column2: 30. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.

column2: 31. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.
column6: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.
column8: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.
column10: accelerate to the speed of traffic.

column2: 32. To make a proper right turn:
column4: slow down and get into the lane nearest the centerline.
column6: give the proper signal and get into the lane nearest the right curb.
column8: swing to the left before turning right.

column2: 33. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column6: having them checked by a mechanic.
column8: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

column2: 34. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column6: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column8: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line
column10: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column6: “Y” intersection ahead
column8: A road joins from the right

column2: 36. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
column6: are changing lanes.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column6: Crossroads ahead

column2: 38. You should increase your following distance:
column6: at night or if it is raining.

column2: 39. Alcohol:
column6: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 40. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column6: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.

column2: 41. At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, drivers should always:
column4: stop, listen for oncoming traffic, and proceed with caution.
column6: slowly pass vehicles the vehicles ahead.
column8: look to the sides of their vehicle to see what is coming.

column2: 42. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
column6: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.
column8: The other answers are both correct.

column2: 43. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column6: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 44. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column6: Brake early and gently.
column8: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

column2: 45. This road sign means:
column6: Lane ends

column2: 46. If you stop along the road at night:
column4: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.
column6: turn on your headlights only.
column10: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.

column2: 47. This road sign means:
column6: One-way traffic

column2: 48. Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a BAC of:
column6: 0.08% or more.

column2: 49. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column6: stop, look left, then right, then left again.
column8: stop, look right, then left, then right again.
column10: follow the vehicle ahead of you.

column2: 50. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column6: Destination signs (guide signs)
